title: Closed-Ended Luxembourg ELTIFs Compulsory Redemption Matters and Compartment Termination & Amalgamation Provisions
author: Ezechiel Havrenne
affiliation: Lecturer at the Luxembourg School of Business
abstract: This article examines the regulatory framework governing closed-ended Luxembourg ELTIFs, focusing on compulsory redemption mechanisms and compartment termination procedures.

title: Investor Oversight or Undue Influence Reassessing BaFin's Stance on AIFM Portfolio Control
author: Delphine Filsack
abstract: This article analyzes BaFin's regulatory approach to AIFM portfolio control, examining the balance between investor oversight and undue influence in fund management.

title: Luxembourg SICARs, SIFs and RAIFs A 20-year Perspective on the Well-Informed Investor notion
author: Karlo Definis
abstract: This article provides a comprehensive analysis of Luxembourg's Well-Informed Investor regime as applied to SICARs, SIFs, and RAIFs, tracing its legislative and regulatory evolution over the past two decades.

title: Digital Asset Regulation in the European Union: A Comparative Analysis
author: Ezechiel Havrenne
affiliation: Lecturer at the Luxembourg School of Business
abstract: This comprehensive study examines the evolving regulatory landscape for digital assets across EU member states, analyzing the impact of MiCA and other regulatory frameworks.

title: Sustainable Finance and ESG Integration in Investment Management
author: Delphine Filsack
abstract: An in-depth analysis of ESG integration strategies in investment management, examining regulatory requirements and best practices for sustainable finance.

title: Fintech Innovation and Regulatory Sandboxes: Lessons from Luxembourg
author: Karlo Definis
abstract: This article explores Luxembourg's approach to fintech innovation through regulatory sandboxes and its implications for the broader European fintech ecosystem.

title: Alternative Investment Fund Managers Directive: Compliance Challenges and Solutions
author: Ezechiel Havrenne
affiliation: Lecturer at the Luxembourg School of Business
abstract: A detailed examination of AIFMD compliance challenges faced by fund managers and practical solutions for meeting regulatory requirements.

title: Risk Management in Digital Asset Portfolios: A Quantitative Approach
author: Delphine Filsack
abstract: This research presents quantitative models for risk management in digital asset portfolios, addressing volatility, correlation, and liquidity challenges.

title: Cross-Border Distribution of Investment Funds: Regulatory Harmonization in the EU
author: Karlo Definis
abstract: Analysis of the EU's cross-border distribution framework and its impact on fund managers seeking to expand across European markets.

title: The Future of Tokenized Assets: Legal and Regulatory Perspectives
author: Ezechiel Havrenne
affiliation: Lecturer at the Luxembourg School of Business
abstract: This forward-looking analysis examines the legal and regulatory challenges of asset tokenization and proposes frameworks for future development.

title: Machine Learning Applications in Investment Management: Regulatory Considerations
author: Delphine Filsack
abstract: This article explores the regulatory implications of machine learning applications in investment management, addressing transparency, accountability, and risk management.

title: Climate Risk Assessment in Investment Portfolios: A Luxembourg Perspective
author: Karlo Definis
abstract: This research presents methodologies for integrating climate risk assessment into investment portfolios, with specific focus on Luxembourg's financial sector.
